factText: Shasta County Sheriff Tom Bosenko said 14 people had been reported missing after the furious wind-driven blaze took residents by surprise and leveled several neighborhoods, though he added that the ho. #CARRFIRE DEATH TOLL IN WILDFIRE NEAR REDDING CLIMBS TO SIX AS FIREFIGHTERS STRUGGLE TO SLOW 89,000-ACRE BLAZE Authorities said a half-dozen other people are still reported missing.

As of Saturday afternoon, the fire's containment had been bumped up to 60 percent after being 45% contained this morning. #CRANSTONFIRE UPDATE: Fire remains just over 13,000 acres, but now at 29% containment. After ripping through the Shasta County city of Redding on Friday, the fire's span tripled overnight to 80,906 acres and is now 5 percent contained.
More than 13,000 acres have burned. Authorities say it was started by an arsonist Wednesday morning.
Nearly 38,000 people were forced from their homes after flames ripped through Shasta County.

factText: Shelter Locations Several locations are available for evacuation shelters in Shasta and Trinity Counties. During fire season every year, scores of residents are evacuated from their houses, with most people lucky to never see their houses destroyed. UPDATE: The Red Cross has opened new shelters to accommodate additional evacuees of the Carr Fire. We are offering discounted rates for anyone who has been evacuated and needs a place to stay starting at $89.

factText: Statewide, over 12,000 firefighters are mobilized according to CAL FIRE. On Saturday morning, some 3,400 firefighters on the ground and in helicopters and airplanes continued to battle the 48,300-acre fire as it ripped through the city of Redding. Firefighters will remain on scene as they work toward full containment of the fire at 10 acres. More than 3,000 fire personnel are battling the flames with more than 300 engines and 17 helicopters

Several are dead and hundreds of homes have been burned to the ground as raging wildfires sweep areas of California.

factText: WE ARE HOME #CranstonFire  Our Heros: Firefighters, Pilots, Police, Volunteers, First Responders & Forest Rangers https://t.co/m0ViV0Z30g. MV Optimist Prez Oscar, Vice Pez Sarah, and junior optimist Lizzy, assisted the Moreno Valley Salvation Army and American Red Cross, at the Cranston fire evacuation center on Saturday.
informationNeeds: CrisisFACTS-002_general_What volunteer efforts are currently active for {event}?

factText: The #SalvationArmy is there too, serving fire responders and victims. Volunteers from the North Bay are rallying support and donations for animals and their owners forced to flee the Carr Fire near Redding in Shasta County.
